topic.title: Disk Space Requirements for Content Fusion

body.p: stores large amounts of data on the disk of the server. This topic provides some guidelines on how to provision the server with storage space.

section.title: How uses disk space
section.p: uses disk space for several purposes:

ol.li:
It stores most of the data generated by users in the /fusion/data/ folder.
Review Tasks
When users upload a review task, although they send only a few files to review, all the files linked from the context DITA Map are uploaded.
To reduce the disk space usage, stores review tasks in groups of 100 and tries to store just one copy of a file uploaded as part of multiple review tasks within the same group. Therefore, you may notice a steeper increase in disk space usage after 100 tasks are created.
Projects
When users create a new project based on a Git repository, a clone of that repository is stored.
Review tasks created within a project store only files that were changed since the review task started.
Deliverables
For projects that have deliverables, stores an additional clone of the Git repository. It also stores 3 outputs for each deliverable.

Docker stores server logs outside the /fusion/data/ folder.
Make sure to configure limits on the amount of logs that are stored.

When an administrator runs a backup script, it stores the backup archive on the server's file system. The size of the backup archive is similar to the size of the /fusion/data/ directory,It is important to move the backups to a different server, ideally in a different geographic region.

section.title: Disk space recommendation
section.p: We recommend to have at least 100GB disk space on the server where you want to install Content Fusion. After that, monitor the available disk space for the /fusion/data/ folder and increase it as needed.
